alert.note: Alert for Smyth; Tazewell (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 5:47PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SMYTH...TAZEWELL AND WESTERN MERCER COUNTIES THROUGH 630 PM EDT... At 542 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking slow-moving thunderstorms across portions of Smyth, Tazewell and Mercer Counties, most of which were moving to the north at less than 10 mph. In addition to the possibility of gusty winds, these storms are producing locally heavy rainfall at rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour. These heavy downpours may result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Marion... Richlands... Bluefield... Tazewell... Saltville... Chilhowie... and Cedar Bluff. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building until the storms leave the area. When encountering heavy rain, drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
